result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nemiah S Farsee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Nemiah S Farsee.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. AMENDED Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered the Jury Trial date VACATED. Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Nemiah S Farsee.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Parties inform the court that a resolution has been reached. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Defense requests a status date for possible resolution.  State's offer will remain open until the status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Jury Trial remains calendared on August 29, 2022 at 8:30 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
State's Witness List - received

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Calendar Call. Defendant appears, Court vacated stayed warrant. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Calendar call scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court, via zoom, with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Samuel E. Simpson on behalf of Michael Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defense request matter set for hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Calendar call scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for an Arraignment. Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense in receipt of discovery and an offer and request case set for a scheduling. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (11 pages) commencing 03-21-2022, by ROBYN D. HARRELL.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski who appears on behalf of Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Wright. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
received and filed.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RLC
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (2/6/22). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Nemiah S Farsee in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 2:30p
